title: Tactical Social Skills and Team Collaboration Development Program for Athletes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of sports event operations, experience in team strategy development, and foundational knowledge of role distribution within groups
context.additional_context: Practical training for in-service professionals in a BYOD environment reflecting real-game scenarios. Particularly integrates social elements like team conflict management, leadership demonstration, and cultural diversity respect into instructional design.

learning_goals: Through simulation activities resembling real-game environments, learners will enhance tactical decision-making abilities and team role-allocation strategies by over 80%.
By collaborating with teammates, learners will improve communication efficiency and civics-based teamwork by 70% during the execution of tactical actions.
Learners will evaluate their tactical knowledge application and ability to manage social relationships during games by creating portfolios based on individual match analyses.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
